For substances in a tank, the greatest amount held in a single vessel, taking into account administrative controls, is used for the calculation (40 CFR 68.25(b)(1)).  According to the Off-Site Consequence Analysis Guidance, in a worst-case release involving a flammable gas, the substance forms a vapor cloud which then detonates (U.S. EPA, May 1996). Ten percent of the total energy available for explosion has been assumed to contribute to the explosive effect (40 CFR 68.25(e)). The distance to the overpressure level of 1 psi is then calculated. 

A Trinitrotoluene (TNT) equivalent equation based on the method presented in the Handbook of Chemical Hazard Analysis Procedures (U.S. EPA) was used to calculate the distance to the overpressure endpoint for the East End Shops largest propylene tank.  Using these calculations, a 1 psi overpressure vapor cloud explosion can reach a distance of 530 feet.

ACCIDENT HISTORY
East End Shops has not had any accidental releases from the propylene process within the last five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN
The RMP regulations require that "response actions have been coordinated with local emergency planning and response agencies" (40 CFR 68.12(b)(3)).   Emergency response activities at the East End Shops facility are coordinated with Virginia Emergency Response Council and the Roanoke Fire/EMS Department.  Depending on the quantity and chemical involved in a "reportable spill," Norfolk Southern's procedures also require the notification of certain local, state, and federal emergency planning and response agencies. 

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Safety and emergency response preparedness is a part of the Norfolk Southern activities.  Exposure risks to employees and the public are minimized through ongoing inspections and regulatory requirements.  At this
time, no further improvements have been identified.
